Transactions

March 9, 1968: Drafted by the Oakland Oaks in the ?? round (?? pick) of the 1968 ABA Draft.

May 23, 1968: Signed a contract with the Oakland Oaks.

June 4, 1968: Drafted by the San Francisco Warriors in the 5th round (57th pick) of the 1968 NBA Draft.

August 21, 1974: Traded by the Virginia Squires with Larry Miller to the San Diego Conquistadors for a draft choice, cash and Johnny Neumann.

January 27, 1976: Traded by the Virginia Squires to the New York Nets for Swen Nater and Billy Schaeffer.

June 17, 1976: Moved from the ABA to the NBA with the New York Nets.

September 10, 1976: Traded by the New York Nets with Brian Taylor, a 1977 1st round draft pick (Otis Birdsong was later selected) and a 1978 1st round draft pick (Phil Ford was later selected) to the Kansas City Kings for Tiny Archibald.

October 10, 1977: Waived by the Kansas City Kings.

October 13, 1977: Signed as a free agent with the San Antonio Spurs.

November 22, 1977: Waived by the San Antonio Spurs.

January 13, 1978: Signed as a free agent with the Milwaukee Bucks.

Frequently Asked Questions

How old is Jim Eakins?

Jim Eakins is 77 years old.

Where was Jim Eakins born?

Jim Eakins was born in Sacramento, California.

When was Jim Eakins born?

Jim Eakins was born on May 24, 1946.

How tall is Jim Eakins?

Jim Eakins is 6-11 (211 cm) tall.

How much did Jim Eakins weigh when playing?

Jim Eakins weighed 215 lbs (97 kg) when playing.

Is Jim Eakins in the Hall of Fame?

Jim Eakins is not in the Hall of Fame.

When was Jim Eakins drafted?

Jim Eakins was drafted by San Francisco Warriors, 5th round (7th pick, 57th overall), 1968 NBA Draft.

What position did Jim Eakins play?

Center and Power Forward.

When did Jim Eakins retire?

Jim Eakins last played in 1978.

What did Jim Eakins average?

Jim Eakins averaged 10.8 points, 7.3 rebounds, and 1.8 assists per game.

How many rings does Jim Eakins have?

Jim Eakins won 2 championships.

What schools did Jim Eakins attend?

Jim Eakins attended Encina in Sacramento, California and BYU.

What are Jim Eakins' nicknames?

Jimbo, Jumbo are nicknames for Jim Eakins.
